Description: Both models face threats related to user account spoofing and unauthorized access to sensitive data.
Both systems utilize input validation and sanitization to prevent data tampering.
Similar attack patterns such as SQL injection and XSS are prevalent in both models.
Both models must comply with GDPR and PCI DSS regulations, focusing on data protection and user privacy.
Both systems are vulnerable to CSRF attacks, which can lead to unauthorized actions on behalf of users.
Both models emphasize the need for secure API endpoints to prevent information disclosure.
Both models are susceptible to data tampering and unauthorized access through insecure API calls.
Both systems face risks from XSS attacks that can compromise user data and session integrity.
Both models must adhere to data protection regulations, focusing on data encryption at rest and in transit.
Both models can aggregate risk assessments related to denial of service attacks, enhancing overall security posture.
